area_name: Realm of the Venusian Love Goddess

content.description:
This is the left of the two short routes (

Deviated Septum

being the right hand line).
content.location: This is on a short wall on the north-facing section on the far right side of the crag near the obvious downclimb.

climbs.name: Scills
climbs.fa: from Tom Hansen's Climber's Guide to Castlewood

content.description:
Climb the right-facing corner crack between

Oof Roof

and

March of the Druids

.

climbs.name: Realm of the Venusian Love Goddess

content.description:
This is the left-most bolted line on the cliff.

Begin between the wall and the adjacent block. Do not back-step stem to the block if you're are claiming an ascent of the line at this posted rating. The crux is down low, and it involves the use of several painfully sharp crimpers.

The route is best done early, when you still have plenty of skin on your tips, otherwise it may be too painful to grasp.
content.location: This is the left-most bolted line on the cliff.

content.description: A thin crux (5.10) gets you to the roof (may be 5.11 for a shorter reach). Pulling the roof and the face above is considerably easier than getting to the roof.
content.location: This is the middle of three bolted lines.

content.description: On the dark face to the left of a shallow chimney is this moderate sport route.  Boulder up to the first bolt, clip it, and crank past the crux to the second bolt.  There is one more bolt to the two bolt anchor on this short route.  Don't cheat by using the crack to the left.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a two boly belay.

climbs.name: Magic Mountain
climbs.fa: [R. Hanson, L. Ankle, N. Bertolis, M. Skapyak, 1988]

content.description: South  from the sport routes and chimney and around the arete is a clean crack in the first inside dihedral.  A thin crack goes up the dihedral.
content.protection: All small pieces.  Small nuts sew up the crack.

content.description:
Find the second next inside corner system to the right of

Magic Mountain

.  There is a boulder/flake at the base of this route.  Climb up through the crack with very few positive holds up high.
content.protection: Standard rack. A #3 Friend fits into the wide middle section.

climbs.name: The Grip of an Android
climbs.fa: from Tom Hansen's Climber's Guide to Castlewood

content.description:
This is just left of

Oof Roof

while facing the cliff.  Start where the right-facing corner goes up to become a small roof.  Climb to a solution pocket and over the block to the top.

This is a weeeee bit harder than it looked.

POISON IVY

is present and accounted for!!!

There are occassional rattlers (I saw someone's dog get bit just a week ago).
content.protection:
Long cord/webbings, use the anchors for "

Another Pointless Excursion of Mediocrity

", throw the mess over the formation and hope it works....
content.location:
It is located on the arete between

"Deviated Septum

" and "

Another Pointless Excursion of Mediocrity

."

climbs.name: Fifteen Feet O' Slack
climbs.fa: [R. Hanson, N. Bertols, M. Skapyak, L. Ankle]

content.description: Going North from the downclimb (and detached block). Find the second major chimney system and climb the dihedral to the left of it.  This is the third or fourth inside corner.
The crux is underclinging off of the obvious, deviated septum feature.
content.location: This is on a short wall on the north-facing section on the far right side of the crag, not too far from the obvious downclimb.

content.description: The next chimney/ crack to the right of the bolted roof  and bolted face offers an interesting lead.  Start off with a tricky move to get onto the route, climb past some wide spots, and make a committing layback off the flake. Topping out is also interesting.  Caution!  There is a loose block or two hiding in the recesses of the chimney.  Also be a little wary of the flake which didn't inspire great amounts of confidence in me.
content.protection: Standard rack- including some larger pieces like some big (8,9,10) hexes and Friends (#3-4).

content.description: Stem a wide flared slot to gain a sloped handrail on the left side. Twist around to grab a flattened cobble on the right hand wall and finish up the right hand face.
content.location: Currently this is the farthest right route on far right north-facing section of the crag, not too far left of the somewhat obvious downclimb.

content.description: This is a short, little blaster. It has a few fun moves.
content.protection: Long cord/webbing, up to BD #4 cams for anchors.
content.location:
It is located between "

Fifteen Feet O' Slack

" and "

Deviated Septum

", eight feet from the second downclimb (chimney with the large block in it).

It is located directly across from the anchor point.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
Realm of the Venusian Love Goddess
